name: The Bootlegger's Anthology - work in progress - v.0.3
author: Icibalus

otherNightReminder: The Warden either shakes their head no or nods yes. If they use their ability, show them each Demon on the script, one after another: the Warden points to a player for each one. :reminder: Mark each player *"Safe from Nth Demon"* as apropriate. Mark the Warden with *"Used ability"* :reminder:. Put the Warden to sleep.
name: Warden
ability: Once per game, at night*, choose a player (not yourself) for each on-script Demon: they are safe from that Demon.

otherNightReminder: If the Steeplejack died tonight, wake them. :reminder: They point to two characters on the script sheet with "You start knowing" in their ability's text: run those characters information for the Steeplejack.
name: Steeplejack
ability: If you die at night, choose 2 “You start knowing” characters & get their info.

otherNightReminder: The Tactician points to 2 players. Indicate which one you think it would benefit the Demon more to kill tonight.
name: Tactician
ability: Each night*, choose 2 living players: learn who of them it'd benefit the Demon most to kill tonight.

name: Astronomer
ability: Once per game, visit the Storyteller to privately learn why they made a decision, but not what it was.

name: Scrounger
ability: Once per game, during the day, visit the Storyteller & choose a player: learn a true statement. If they’re evil, it’s false instead.

firstNightReminder: Show the Insomniac the nearest "Each night" character. :reminder:
name: Insomniac
ability: You start knowing the nearest “Each night” character (not the Demon), or that none are in play.

firstNightReminder: Show the Huntress the nearest Minion character :reminder:, then point to your left or your right to indicate which direction it's closer in.
name: Huntress
ability: You start knowing the nearest Minion character & whether it’s clockwise or anticlockwise from you.

firstNightReminder: The Falconer points to a character on their character sheet :reminder:: mark the player with that character with *"Chosen"*, or mark the Falconer with *"Not-in-play"* if no player has that character.
otherNightReminder: You may wake the Falconer, 4 nights after their last choice, you must. Point to the player with that character, or shake your head to indicate it's not in play. The Falconer chooses a new character :reminder: mark the player with that character with *"Chosen"*, or mark the Falconer with *"not-in-play"* if no player has that character. Remove all other Falconer reminders from the Grimoire.
name: Falconer
ability: On your 1st night, choose a character. 1-4 nights later, you learn who it is (or that it’s not in play), then choose again.

firstNightReminder: Show the Insomniac the nearest *"Once per game"* character. :reminder:
name: Teacher
ability: You start knowing the nearest “Once per game” character (not the Demon), or that none are in play.

firstNightReminder: Show the Tax Collector two in-play characters, mark them with *"Shown"* :reminder:. The Tax Collector holds up a number of fingers: note that number.
otherNightReminder: On the night the Tax Collector chose, if they have not nominated one of the characters you showed them, they die. :reminder: Mark them with a shroud and *"Dies tonight"*
name: Tax Collector
ability: You start knowing 2 in-play characters, then choose a night*. If you haven't nominated 1 of those characters by that night, you die.

otherNightReminder: The first time the Demon picks the Silversmith, shake your head no and indicate they should pick someone else instead. :reminder: Mark the Silversmith with *"Saved self once"* On future nights, they may choose & kill the Silversmith once.
name: Silversmith
ability: While 3 live (not Travelers), you decide who is executed. The 1st time the Demon chooses you, they must choose someone else instead.

otherNightReminder: If no-one died yesterday, wake the Vampire, and show them 1 out-of-play character for every day they survived. The Vampire dies. :reminder:
name: Vampire
ability: Each night*, if no-one died yesterday, you die, then learn 1 out-of-play character for each day you survived.

otherNightReminder: The Prankster points to a player. Put them to sleep. If it's a Minion, mark that player with *"Pranked"* :reminder:, then wake that Minion and show them the "This character affected you" card and the Prankster token. All *"Pranked"* Minions choose a player; mark that player with *"Demon Learns Tonight."* :reminder: Finally, wake the Demon, and point to each player marked *"Demon learns tonight"* in turn, and show them the corresponding character.
name: Prankster
ability: Each night*, choose a player: if a Minion, their ability becomes "Each night, choose a player: the Demon learns their character."

firstNightReminder: Wake a Minion. Show them the Parvenu token, then point to the Parvenu. Mark them with *"Jealous"* :reminder:
otherNightReminder: If the *"Jealous"* Minion was not, by your judgement,"mad" about the Parvenu being evil yesterday, you may decide to kill them. :reminder:
name: Parvenu
ability: 1 Minion starts knowing you. Each night*, if they weren't "mad" about you being evil yesterday, they might die.

name: Grandmaster
ability: Once per game, during the day, visit the Storyteller to learn your most important ally, but not why they’re important.

firstNightReminder: The Demon chooses a player tonight, unlike normal: mark that player with *"Dies in 1 night"* :reminder:. Wake the Duelist. Show them the player marked with the *"Dies in 1 night"* reminder. Replace that reminder at the end of today; that player dies when the Demon chooses.
otherNightReminder: Do not kill the player the Demon chooses; instead, mark them with *"Dies in 1 night"* :reminder:. Wake the Duelist. Show them the player marked with the *"Dies in 1 night"* reminder.  Replace that reminder at the end of today; that player dies when the Demon chooses.
name: Duelist
ability: The Demon attacks on the 1st night, but its’ victims die 1 night later. Each night, you learn who the Demon chose.

name: Archivist
ability: Each day, you may visit the Storyteller & privately ask a yes/no question about the Demon’s ability.

name: Beachcomber
ability: Each day, visit the Storyteller to learn 1 fact no other on-script Townsfolk could learn with their ability.

otherNightReminder: If the first execution was yesterday, and it was by the Firebrand's nomination, they wake & choose a player: show them that player's character. :reminder:
name: Firebrand
ability: If you nominate & execute the 1st player executed, choose a player tonight: learn their character (even if dead).

firstNightReminder: Show the Local Hero an in-play Minion or Demon. Mark that character with *"Shown"* :reminder:
otherNightReminder: If the Demon kills the Local Hero, mark the *"Shown"* character with *"Dies"*- they die too. :reminder:
name: Local Hero
ability: You start knowing an opposing in-play character. If the Demon kills you, the character you learned dies too.

firstNightReminder: The Haruspex shakes their head no or points to a player. If they point to a player, mark them with *"Used ability"* :reminder:. If they pointed to a Demon, swap that Demon's character with a living Minion's (if able), then inform the swapped players of their new characters.
otherNightReminder: The Haruspex shakes their head no or points to a player. If they point to a player, mark them with *"Used ability"* :reminder:. If they pointed to a Demon, swap that Demon's character with a living Minion's (if able), then inform the swapped players of their new characters.
name: Haruspex
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player: chosen Demons swap characters with a living Minion (if able).

firstNightReminder: If the Inventor has an ability, run that ability.
otherNightReminder: If the Inventor has an ability, run that ability.
name: Inventor
ability: Once per game, during the day, privately design your ability: learn a condition. When met, you gain that ability.

name: Clairvoyant
ability: If you died last night, you may visit the Storyteller today to learn 1 fact about the Demon's bluffs.

name: Pilgrim
ability: Each day, you may visit the Storyteller to learn a Traveller the Storyteller would like to travel in, and a hint as to why.

name: Crime Writer
ability: The Demon also has the Butler’s ability. [-the Butler]

firstNightReminder: You may wake the Occultist and indicate any form of information you wish; mark them with *"Learned info"* afterwards. :reminder: They will not wake again.
otherNightReminder: You may wake the Occultist and indicate any form of information you wish; mark them with *"Learned info"* afterwards: :reminder:They will not wake again.
name: Occultist
ability: You might be executed unless you are “mad” about having learned something new every day. Once per game, at night, you learn something.

otherNightReminder: If the Deserter is marked with *"Switches teams tonight"*, wake them and inform them they are now evil.
name: Deserter
ability: The 1st time a dead player votes, become their alignment tonight.

otherNightReminder: If the Cardinal is marked with *"Switches teams tonight"* :reminder:, inform them of their new alignment.
name: Cardinal
ability: If a player nominates you, become the opposite alignment tonight (even if dead.)

firstNightReminder: Wake the Sleepwalker, and act as though they had the ability they think they do: secretly run the ability they actually have. Wake 1 Good player, and show them the Sleepwalker token.
otherNightReminder: Wake the Sleepwalker, and act as though they had the ability they think they do: secretly run the ability they actually have.
name: Sleepwalker
ability: You think you’re a Townsfolk, but you have a different ability with the same choices. 1 good player knows you’re in play.

name: Perfumer
ability: The 1st time a Minion or Demon is nominated & executed by evil, their Townsfolk neighbors are poisoned (even if you’re dead).

name: Escape Artist
ability: Once, at dawn, you may declare that if a good player dies today, good loses, but if evil dies, you learn who the Demon is. If you died, you must.

firstNightReminder: Pretend to the Wind-Viced they have the Minion ability they think they have. If it is in play, it is an Au'Wre game; do not run Minion info.
otherNightReminder: Pretend to the Wind-Viced they have the Minion ability they think they have.
name: Wind-Viced
ability: You think you are a Minion, but you are not. [The Demon is Au’Wre]

otherNightReminder: If the Turncoat was more "mad" than anyone else about wanting to execute the player who is the Demon, wake them up and show them the "You are:" card, then give them a thumbs down. Show them the "Your Demon is:" card, then point to the Demon.
name: Turncoat
ability: If you are the most “mad” about wanting to execute the Demon player :reminder:, you become evil tonight & learn who the Demon is.

name: Wight
ability: The 1st player you nominated while alive and voted for while dead are poisoned (even when dead).

firstNightReminder: Wake the Visionary and show them a piece of paper with a question written on it. Put them to sleep. Wake a good player :reminder: and show them the same piece of paper. Put them to sleep.
name: Visionary
ability: You & a good player start knowing a question. Once per game, publicly answer it: if correct, your team wins.

firstNightReminder: Show the Huli Jing 5 out-of-play characters: mark each with *"Seen"* :reminder:. Then, they pick one: mark it with *"Has ability of & might register as"* :reminder:. Until dusk, run that ability as if the Huli Jing was that character, and you may register the Huli Jing as that character or alignment.
otherNightReminder: The Huli Jing points to a character on their character sheet: mark it with *"Has ability of & might register as"* :reminder:. Until dusk, run that ability as if the Huli Jing was that character, and you may register the Huli Jing as that character or alignment.
reminders: Has ability of & might register as
name: Huli Jing
ability: You start knowing 5 out-of-play characters. Each night, choose 1 of them: until dusk, gain its’ ability & you might register as it would.

otherNightReminder: The Executioner shakes their head no or indicates a number from 1 to 3. If they indicate a number, mark that many players with *"Dies"* :reminder:; if it's 2 or 3, you must mark the Executioner this way. No other "Dies" reminders may be placed tonight, and nobody else may die.
name: Executioner
ability: Once per game, at night*, choose that 1-3 players die tonight & nobody else can die. If you chose 2 or 3, you’re one of them.

firstNightReminder: Show each of the in-play Good characters in no particular order to the Sallow. They indicate one of those on their character sheet; mark them with a *"Might Register Falsely"* reminder. :reminder:
otherNightReminder: If a player with a "Might Register Falsely" reminder :reminder: died tonight or yesterday, wake the Sallow. They indicate a good character on their character sheet: mark them with a "Might Register Falsely" reminder.
name: Sallow
ability: You start knowing which opposing characters are in-play. Then, choose 1 of them: they might register falsely. If they die, choose again.

firstNightReminder: Wake the Miasma. They shake their head no or nod yes. If they nodded yes, mark them with *"Used ability"* & *"Townsfolk are poisoned + get false info tonight."* :reminder: Remove the latter reminder at dusk.
otherNightReminder: Wake the Miasma. They shake their head no or nod yes. If they nodded yes, mark them with *"Used ability"* & *"Townsfolk are poisoned + get false info tonight."* :reminder: Remove the latter reminder at dusk.
reminders: Townsfolk are poisoned + get false info tonight
name: Miasma
ability: Once per game, at night, choose that all Townsfolk are poisoned & their abilities yield false info until dusk.

otherNightReminder: The Spectre points to 2 Townsfolk or Outsiders on their character sheet. Mark a chosen in-play character with *"Cannot view Spectre or Demon correctly."* reminder :reminder:
reminders: Cannot view Spectre or Demon correctly.
name: Spectre
ability: Each night*, choose up to 2 good characters: you & the Demon register falsely to those abilities (if in play).

name: Vessel
ability: 1 Demon is marked on the script with 🕱. If the Demon dies & 5 or more non-Travelers live, become the marked Demon.

firstNightReminder: If another player chooses the Wind Nymph with their ability at night, all negative effects of that ability are removed, and that player swaps characters with the Wind Nymph: show each their new characters. :reminder:
otherNightReminder: If another player chooses the Wind Nymph with their ability at night, all negative effects of that ability are removed, and that player swaps characters with the Wind Nymph: show each their new characters. :reminder:
name: Wind Nymph
ability: You are safe from evil abilities. The 1st evil player to choose you with their ability each night swaps characters with you. [+1 Outsider]

firstNightReminder: Replace the Mouldwarp token with an out-of-play Demon of your choice. Show the Mouldwarp their new character, then mark them with *"Has Mouldwarp Ability."
otherNightReminder: Each Demon can only wake every other night. If a Demon woke to kill someone with their ability tonight, mark them with *"Doesn't wake tomorrow night"* :reminder:. Skip the ability steps of any Demon marked with *"Doesn't wake tomorrow night"*, then replace it with *"Wakes tomorrow night"*. :reminder:
name: Mouldwarp
ability: On your 1st night, become an out-of-play Demon with this ability. Demons only wake to kill every other night (even if dead).

firstNightReminder: Skip the Minion info step, and do not show the Au'Wre their Minions during the Demon info step. This ability applies even if the Au'Wre is somehow drunk or poisoned.
otherNightReminder: The Au'Wre points to a number of players equal to their in-play Minions (if they don't know how many that is, signal it). If they chose every Minion, mark the Au'Wre with *"Found"* :reminder:, and announce that Good must kill evil today or win at dawn.
name: Au'wre
ability: Each night*, guess your Minions: learn which are correct. If all are, good learns this, and must kill evil today or lose. [Evil don’t learn each other]

firstNightReminder: During Minion info, the Minions wake together and agree on a player. That player becomes an evil Cawthane; inform them of their new character.
otherNightReminder: The Cawthane chooses a player :reminder:: mark that player with *"Dies"*, and a shroud: they are dead.
name: Cawthane
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. [Minions choose who you are, +1 Outsider]

otherNightReminder: The Terminus chooses a player :reminder:: mark that player with "Dies", and a shroud: they are dead.
name: Terminus
ability: Each night*, choose a player, they die. While 3 are alive, the nominee with the least votes is executed instead. (Travellers don’t count.)

firstNightReminder: If the Trizkidek added an Outsider during setup, mark them with *"added Outsider"* :reminder:
otherNightReminder: The Trizkidek chooses either 1 or 3 players (3 if they removed an Outsider, 1 if they added 1). Mark one of the players they chose with *"Poisoned until dusk"* :reminder:: they are poisoned. Then, mark one of the players they chose with *"Dies"* :reminder:: they die
name: Trizkidek
ability: Each night*, choose 3 players: 1 is poisoned until dusk & 1 dies. If you added an Outsider, choose 1 instead. [-1 or +1 Outsider]

firstNightReminder: Wake the Inysyns and show them a number: note that number. On the night before that day, mark the Inysnys with *"Day of Judgement today"* :reminder:: if they would lose today, they win instead.
otherNightReminder: The Insyns chooses a player :reminder:: mark that player with *"Dies"*, and a shroud: they are dead.
name: Inysyns
ability: You start knowing a day. On that day (from dawn to dusk) if good would win, evil wins instead. Each night*, choose a player: they die.

otherNightReminder: The Unseelie chooses a player :reminder:: mark that player with *"Dies"*, and a shroud: they are dead. If it was an Outsider, mark them with *"Secretly Dead"* :reminder: instead; they are dead, and any abilities that trigger based on death trigger, but they are not announced as dead until they're executed.
name: Unseelie
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Outsiders you kill register as and think they’re alive until executed. [+1 Outsider]

firstNightReminder: Show the Obscrul a piece of paper with their ability printed on it; give them a while to fully understand it.
otherNightReminder: Run that ability. It should usually involve the Obscrul choosing a player, and that player dying. :reminder:
name: Obscrul
ability: Your ability is unknown to all but you. Once per game, the Archivist may publicly guess it: if right, you die. [+the Archivist]
